result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:09 AM Defendant Jonah O. Carrico appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
The defendant qualifies for a Public Defender but they have not found an attorney to represent him yet. Court explains the defendant's options. 
The defendant wishes to wait for the Public Defender. Defendant is willing to waive the statutory time limits in which a preliminary hearing must be held. 
Court finds good cause to toll the time limits and the matter is adjourned.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts 2nd degree sexual assault of a child.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br.2.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with A.R.B., DOB: 04-23-2007 or any premises they occupy, maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
